cont.entity_a: Makes very smooth and accurate cuts on extruded aluminum. Smooth cutting action with a high-quality finish, comparable to a wet horizontal bandsaw. Cuts through aluminum and PVC cleanly without lubricant issues. Cuts aluminum picture frame molding cleanly with minimal touch-up required. Cuts 6061 T6 Aluminum cleanly and easily. Metal cutting blade provides a smooth cut on plexiglass mirrors without chipping. Fast and clean cuts through extruded aluminum and 2-inch angle. Cuts aluminum like wood with minimal burrs or heat buildup when lubricated.
cont.entity_b: Cuts 3/8 inch steel sheet better than a plasma cutter. Suitable for cutting various metal thicknesses without needing grinding. Can cut 2-inch solid shafts quickly. Cuts thicker steel with ease, comparable to cutting wood.

cont.entity_a: Used the first blade for over three years on thin to 1/4 inch aluminum without problems. Remains sharp after several hundred cuts. Durable, with a long-lasting sharpness, even after extensive use.
cont.entity_b: Outlasts most blades except Diablo, even with broken teeth. Long-lasting performance on quarter inch material with proper guidance.

cont.entity_a: The blade is thicker and heavier, providing stabilization for smoother cuts. Vibration damping slots effectively reduce chatter. The blade's thickness results in a larger kerf than desired.
cont.entity_b: Milwaukee 42 tooth blade works well for most metal cutting applications. Requires careful use to avoid chipping or losing teeth.

cont.entity_a: Highly effective for cutting tough aluminum for ultralight aircraft construction. Ideal for cutting extruded aluminum tubing.
cont.entity_b: Ideal for cutting 1/2 inch steel plate for truck frames. Recommended for thin metal stock and 50T for thin material.

cont.entity_a: Effective for cutting aluminum sections over 1/4 inch, despite not being intended for such use.
cont.entity_b: Performs well on low rpm circular or chop saws.
Smooth cutting performance, but pricey compared to Diablo blades. Cost-effective compared to other blades for steel cutting.

cont.entity_a: 72 tooth blade suitable for both thin and thick extrusions without requiring a large saw.
cont.entity_b: Best value for metal cutting blades.

cont.entity_a: Installed on a compound miter saw.
Frustration with receiving the incorrect thin version of the blade multiple times.
Requires lubrication for optimal performance and longevity.
